intro: Senecio incanus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
